div.p: Franciscus Portus writes from Italy that there are great preparations being made by the Turk both by land and sea, and that the Venetians are afraid, and they themselves are also preparing a fairly large fleet, namely 80 triremes and five larger ones, which are commonly called "galeas grossas." The Duke of Florence fears for himself from the King of Spain, who has made the son of Count Petilianus an emissary against the Duke himself; this son of the Count is said to have occupied certain fortified places and a port near Siena, from where he harasses the Sienese and Florentine countryside with daily incursions. [on the back] News for Mr. Bullinger.
